Key Match Events: India win by seven wickets to extend winning start and end Pakistan's
Rohit Sharma scored 86 off 63 balls, including six sixes
Pakistan slipped from 155-2 to 191 all out
Bumrah, Siraj, Hardik, Kuldeep & Jadeja all took two wickets
Mohammed Siraj bowled Babar Azam on 50
Post-Match Reflections: Waqar Younis commented that India are getting stronger at home and it's getting harder for Pakistan to beat them
Mickey Arthur, Pakistan's coach, remained upbeat and looked forward to meeting India again in the final
Waqar Younis criticized Babar's captaincy and mentioned issues with Shaheen Afridi's performance
Carlos Brathwaite noted Shaheen Afridi's lack of prodigious swing and Hassan Ali's reduced pace
Deep Dasgupta commented on Shaheen Afridi's fitness and lack of a plan B
Rohit Sharma praised the bowlers for setting up the game and emphasized the importance of role clarity
Babar Azam reflected on the collapse in the middle order and the failure to finish well
Jonathan Agnew noted the difficulty for Pakistan playing in front of a crowd of Indian supporters
Carlos Brathwaite described India's victory as convincing and dominating
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won with 117 balls remaining, although not their biggest victory over Pakistan in terms of balls left in ODIs
Fireworks lit up the night sky in Ahmedabad after the match
